body_content.explanation: to separate from someone or something else; to separate something from something else that it was joined to or part of:
examples: Tractors that haul Mexican-made goods to American consumers must decouple from their trailers on the Mexican side.
The optimists thought the rest of the world would be able to decouple from the problems of the American housing market.
Some people hope to decouple migration policy from party politics.
